abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Aquatic Biodiversity
            Conservation Project in Bangladesh were as follows: outcomes
            were moderately satisfactory, the risk to global environment
            outcome was moderate, the Bank performance was moderately
            satisfactory, and the Borrower performance was moderately
            satisfactory. Lessons learned included: 1) User rights over
            common property resources are fundamental; 2) Simple
            cost-effective entry points are needed in open water
            fisheries; 3) Community involvement in preparation through
            monitoring of construction works increases quality; 4)
            Political support is critical to sustain nature conservation
            efforts; 5) Dealing with social change demands longer time
            and realistic targets; and 6) Flexibility is needed in case
            of community driven process oriented programs.
